columns.name: name
columns.description: The resource name.

columns.name: id
columns.description: The resource ID.

columns.name: provisioning_state
columns.description: The provisioning state of the load balancer resource. Possible values include: 'Succeeded', 'Updating', 'Deleting', 'Failed'.

columns.name: type
columns.description: The resource type.

columns.name: etag
columns.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

columns.name: extended_location_name
columns.description: The name of the extended location.

columns.name: extended_location_type
columns.description: The type of the extended location. Possible values include: 'ExtendedLocationTypesEdgeZone'.

columns.name: resource_guid
columns.description: The resource GUID property of the load balancer resource.

columns.name: sku_name
columns.description: Name of the load balancer SKU. Possible values include: 'Basic', 'Standard', 'Gateway'.

columns.name: sku_tier
columns.description: Tier of the load balancer SKU. Possible values include: 'Regional', 'Global'.

columns.name: backend_address_pools
columns.description: Collection of backend address pools used by the load balancer.

columns.name: diagnostic_settings
columns.description: A list of active diagnostic settings for the load balancer.

columns.name: frontend_ip_configurations
columns.description: Object representing the frontend IPs to be used for the load balancer.

columns.name: inbound_nat_pools
columns.description: Defines an external port range for inbound NAT to a single backend port on NICs associated with the load balancer. Inbound NAT rules are created automatically for each NIC associated with the Load Balancer using an external port from this range. Defining an Inbound NAT pool on the Load Balancer is mutually exclusive with defining inbound Nat rules. Inbound NAT pools are referenced from virtual machine scale sets. NICs that are associated with individual virtual machines cannot reference an inbound NAT pool. They have to reference individual inbound NAT rules.

columns.name: inbound_nat_rules
columns.description: Collection of inbound NAT Rules used by the load balancer. Defining inbound NAT rules on the load balancer is mutually exclusive with defining an inbound NAT pool. Inbound NAT pools are referenced from virtual machine scale sets. NICs that are associated with individual virtual machines cannot reference an Inbound NAT pool. They have to reference individual inbound NAT rules.

columns.name: load_balancing_rules
columns.description: Object collection representing the load balancing rules Gets the provisioning.

columns.name: outbound_rules
columns.description: The outbound rules.

columns.name: probes
columns.description: Collection of probe objects used in the load balancer.

columns.name: title
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionTitle

columns.name: tags
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionTags

columns.name: region
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionRegion

columns.name: resource_group
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionResourceGroup
